description.narrative: Energy audit program for large industry and SMEs implemented
F Share of energy audits in Turkey leading to actual investments in EE in industry

comment.narrative: Less than 10 to be verified and adjusted within 1st project year
At least 50

1 An audit checklist including around 80 questions about boilers pumps compressed air etc prepared by project consultants was finalized by the contribution of the YEGM experts who had considerable experience in undertaking energy audits in the field The checklist is ready to use for walk through energy audits particularly in the utilities and general systems of the factories The checklist was used during the training of the ESCOs EVD companies and the audit of the Arcelik plant
2 The checklist will be supplemented by more detailed material for certain energyintensive processes especially in iron steel cement ceramics paper and pulp and chemicals industries To find a competent company having experts in these fields an RFP was prepared and submitted to the NPD for his approval in April 2015 The tender is expected to be announced in August 2015
3 Within the context of the developing of an audit methodology the EE auditing guide including audit report template basic principles etc was developed and modified according to ISO 50002 which was issued in June 2014
4 Energy Audits The pilot phase of the energy audit activities was started in February 2015 Nine industrial facilities out of 51 which had previously been invited by GDRE officially applied to be a part of the auditing program Necessary background information of participating industrial companies for the bidding process such as energy consumption production processes the capacity of electricity transformers features of steam systems number of compressors motors etc was collected by YEGM and the bidding process was initiated in January 2015 Seven eligible EVD companies were invited to bid Six of them submitted their proposals on time The contracting was finalized in February 2015 and the preaudits walk through energy audits WTEAs were realized in March 2015 The WTEA reports were collected in April 2015 In May 2015 the evaluation committee held a 2 day meeting to assess the 9 reports Letters providing the feedback from the evaluation committee were sent to the EVD companies The EVD companies revised the reports and submitted the modified versions in June 2015 They were all reevaluated and accepted The EVD companies are now undertaking detailed energy audits After the evaluation of the detailed energy audit reports the new audit program will be designed in the light of lessons learned
5 For further audits there will be a call for proposal including feasibility study supports In this call for proposal the industrial companies will be invited to join the program for i audits ii feasibility studies by committing that they will produce investment projects which will also later be supported by the YEGM The preparations studies are ongoing for this program

description.narrative: To improve energy efficiency of the Turkish industry by enabling and encouraging companies in the industrial sector for efficient management of energy use by different energy conservation measures and energy efficient technologies
B Direct and indirect emission reductions

comment.narrative: GHG emissions from industry were around 665 MktCO2 in 2009 and are projected to grow to 1153 MtCO2 by 2025

Direct emission reduction associated with demo projects of 609 ktCO2 pa and assuming an average 10year lifetime of energy investment 609 ktCO2 cumulatively
Cumulative indirect emission reduction due to projects capacity building activities ranging from 18 MtCO2 bottomup approach to 327 MtCO2 topdown

No actual emission savings to date Emission savings from EE investments will be measured after the other activities of the project will result in actual investments There are some means for this aim such as i energy audits ii developing energy management units in organized industrial zones iii technical expertlevel trainings in which industrial companies attend for establishing energy management system in their facilities On those 3 topics there are certain progress i The pilot audit program was initiated ii The OIZs were selected and equipment tender is ongoing iii The call for expertlevel training was completed and the dates were determined Despite all mentioned progress a little more time is needed to see the actual investments
ISO 50001 and Energy Management System trainings are likely to play a significant role for reducing indirect emissions These trainings would be supportive to take action for reducing energy use by simple measures which do not entail serious investments More information on EnMS trainings is given in part of outcome2

description.narrative: A Energy savings from EE investments in industrial sector compared to baseline

comment.narrative: Technical energy savings potential in industry estimated at around 20
At least 190 GWh per year energy and fuel

Initially anticipated energy savings numbers were reviewed as the analytical part of the baseline study that could not be completed before To undertake this task a consultant was hired The consultant elaborated on the baseline energy consumption patterns of the industrial subsectors By using both top down and bottom up approaches both energy intensity and specific energy consumption data he recalculated all the baseline data Relying on this method and the revised past data he also fulfilled energy consumption forecasts The findings were shared withappreciated by all project partners The consultant is currently developing alternative scenarios to calculate the possible energy and CO2 savings through the project activities
No actual energy savings to date Energy savings from EE investments will be measured after the other activities of the project will result in actual investments There are some means for this aim such as i energy audits ii developing energy management units in organized industrial zones iii technical expertlevel trainings in which industrial companies attend for establishing energy management system in their facilities On those 3 topics there are certain progress i The pilot audit program was initiated ii The OIZs were selected and equipment tender is ongoing iii The call for expertlevel training was completed and the dates were determined Despite all mentioned progress a little more time is needed to see the actual investments
It is possible there were some investments resulting from the initial EnMS training however those savings would most likely be minimal at this point
